Moral phrases have gota new literary application: ‘rectum’ ‘virtus' ‘vitium' ‘error,' ‘quod decet,' ‘vir bonus et pmdens! It is as though Horace's two tastes and interests had run at last into one stream. Philosophy is no longer the rival of poetry, but has become her instructress. The study of the ‘Socraticae chartae’ has ended in the Rhetoric and Poetic.
